subject: Philosophy
title: Critical Thinking in the Age of Information
description: A 60-second lesson on Critical Thinking in the Age of Information.

hook.text: You see a claim shared ten thousand times. It must be true ‚Äî right? Not even close.

buildup.text: Misinformation spreads faster than truth online. Algorithms amplify outrage, not accuracy.

discovery.text: Critical thinking requires asking: what's the source? What's the evidence? What's being left out?

twist.text: Most people never check. Sharing feels like knowing. But virality has nothing to do with truth.

climax.text: In an era of infinite information, the ability to think logically isn't optional ‚Äî it's survival.

punchline.text: More information demands more critical thinking, not less.

quiz.question: Why is critical thinking more important in the information age?
options: Misinformation spreads faster than truth online
